Subject: Solution parameters additional to network
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=175530192; y=bLJKa-cBGql8_KInBq3S-xySEBnoLqyN3amAzil9SV4BKWio
X-Yahoo-Profile: rmarsdena
From: rob <rob@...>

I'm using the MultiNEAT library to solve a couple of  problems that 
would seem to be disparate in nature, but, both require facilities that 
lie outside of NEAT.

The first manages a batch chemical process and controls the optimal 
yield cut-off point. The second manages a portfolio of currencies held 
as a pool for an import/manufacturing/export business.

We have found that both solutions need initial parameters that are best 
included in the training. As an example of the first problem we can 
choose one nozzle. from a set of 10, that materially effect flow rate of 
one component, but the nozzle can only be changed at plant maintenance 
time. In the second example we're looking at a one or two time 
constants. One of these effects the business cycle and should really be 
arranged to fit several cycles into the accounting cycle.

My question is...
Does MultiNEAT offer any way of adding such trainable parametric data to 
the genome, without impinging directly on the network? I've examined the 
source code and found nothing obvious. Should I consider adding my own 
flavour of a gene to sit alongside the network, and which implements its 
own breeding and mutation?

Rob Marsden
